intro: Chamissoa altissima var. rubella, commonly known as the red-flowered mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features dense clusters of small, showy red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically dark green and leathery, adapted to thrive in well-drained, rocky soils. Chamissoa altissima var. rubella is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to the unique flora of these high-elevation ecosystems.
